item.title: Missile Command Delta announced for PS5, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/missile-command-delta-announced-for-ps5-switch-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Developed by Mighty Yell and 13AM Games. Due out in 2025.

Publisher Atari and developers Mighty Yell and 13AM Games have announced Missile Command Delta, a reimagining of Atari’s 1980s missile defense arcade classic as a turn-based tactical game, for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch in 2025.

“While Missile Command Delta approaches gameplay in a completely new way, it retains all the tension and suspense of the arcade original,” said Atari vice president of games Ethan Stearns in a press release. “You have to think strategically about every move you make because even one poor choice can have grave consequences.”

Stearns continued, “Missile Command Delta has a little something for every kind of player—whether you love strategy tactics games, are a mystery fan, a secret hunting completionist, or you just love to explore and solve puzzles. We can’t wait for players to get their hands on the game later this year.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Atari:

Missile Command Delta reimagines Atari’s 1980s missile defense arcade classic as a turn-based tactical game set against a mysterious narrative that leaves you questioning whether you’re trapped in a simulation or truly defending cities from attack.

As players explore an abandoned half-century old facility they will encounter locked doors, dishevelled work rooms, massive super computers and newly awakened missile command terminals. Players must defend against waves of missiles from an unknown enemy using a battery of missiles, each with its own unique type, range, and explosion size. Only by managing their arsenal carefully will they have enough firepower to clear the skies.

As enemy attacks increase and pressure mounts, relationships will be put to the test, blurring the lines between what is real and who they can trust. If they succeed, they may even learn the truth behind this Cold War defense program.

item.title: 3D platformer Foldy’s OS Quest announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/3d-platformer-foldys-os-quest-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Run, jump, zip, surf, and stomp your way through a digital world.

Developer Vacation Home has announced Foldy’s OS Quest, a 3D platformer set in a colorful, computerized world. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The first game from Vacation Home, Foldy’s OS Quest invites players into a colorful computerized world for an action-packed 3D platforming adventure like no other!

Foldy is a carefree anti-virus file folder, living blissfully on the Digital Desktop. But when a massive virus invades his peaceful operating system, spreading its influence to all corners of his world, Foldy must spring into action with the help of his newfound companion, Mouse!

Run, jump, zip, surf, and stomp your way through levels inspired by the magical world of personal computing, and take down the virus before it can break through the Firewall!

Key Features

  • Explore seven uniquely themed levels, each one based around a unique corner of Foldy’s digital world, from desktop games to social media and even down into the darkest depths of the Recycle Bin!
  • Pick up collectibles to unlock challenging bonus levels, the ultimate test of your skills!
  • Return to previously cleared levels to try your hand at Time Trials, and unlock new moves to bring your times down even further!

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Risk it all in a single destructive blow.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Tamsoft have released a new character trailer for fighting action game Bleach: Rebirth of Souls highlighting playable fighter Ichigo Kurosaki (The Final Getsugatensho).

According to his description, Ichigo’s Final Getsugatensho form can risk it all in a single destructive blow. It is the end of a Substitute Soul Reaper, now turned into a blade.

Bleach: Rebirth of Souls is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam on March 21.

item.title: KARMA: The Dark World demo for PS5, PC now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/karma-the-dark-world-demo-for-ps5-pc-now-available

  • PC
  • PS5

Step into a realm of nightmares.

Publisher Wired Productions and developer Pollard Studio have released a demo for psychological horror game KARMA: The Dark World for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store and PC via Steam, the companies announced.

Here is an overview of the demo, via its store pages:

About the Demo

Do you think that the glimpse of a memory is the absolute truth?

This is the demo for Karma: The Dark World, showing you the first hour of the game which consists of a prologue introducing you to Daniel and his Dark World—before tasking you with investigating the strange events at the Winston institute and to experience them first hand in a brain dive.

“Who controls the past controls the future; who controls the present controls the past.”

About the Game

Karma: The Dark World is a first-person cinematic psychological thriller set in a dystopian world where the Leviathan Corporation is omnipresent. The year is 1984, the place is East Germany, and things are not quite what they seem.

Explore an alternate timeline set in 1984 East Germany; the Leviathan Corporation rules with an iron fist, controlling its citizens through mass surveillance, social class rules, mind altering drugs and the promise that the gates to Utopia will open to those who serve.

Key Features

  • Become a Roam Agent – Step into the shoes of Daniel McGovern and use a combination of investigative tools, interviews and your own keen intellect to solve puzzles and unravel the truth.
  • Open Your Mind – Dive into the memories of suspects to retrace their steps and piece together your investigations, but be careful – the human mind is a dangerous place where emotions, will and desire hold power.
  • Discover the Truth – Keep your sanity and wits about you whilst uncovering a dark story of love, loss and deception, where nothing is as it seems and every turn brings another twist to unravel.
  • Next-Generation Visuals – Explore a meticulously detailed world with stunning visuals and effects all powered by Unreal Engine 5.
  • An Unforgettable Soundtrack – A specially created soundtrack that combines orchestral scores with original songs that draw you into the cinematic world of Karma, created in collaboration with Dolby Atmos.

KARMA: the Dark World is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on March 27 for $24.99 / €24.99 / £19.99, followed by Xbox Series at a later date.
